entries.title: Wind Technician Lead
entries.content: RESPONSIBILITIES :          	   Provides leadership and direction for staff involved in regular preventative maintenance and repair activities consistent with policies and procedures on wind turbine generators     	   An employee in this position typically spends 80% of their time providing leadership & assurance to team in the field (performing quality control checks, etc.) and 20% of their time completing administrative tasks (ordering supplies, approving work orders, etc.)     	   Provides daily updates to production supervisor     	   Responsible for scheduling and assigning duties and may assist in evaluating performance     	   Provides expertise to assist in the troubleshooting, identification, and implementation of electronic and mechanical failures, problems and corrective actions, and repairs on wind turbines and other iated equipment     	   Thoroughly understands the mechanics, including both electrical and maintenance of hydraulics, of all wind turbine components     	   Monitors turbine performance and leads documentation & reporting activities. Interprets fault reports, maintains power generation reports and service logs in computer database     	   Attends/leads regular safety meetings and follows appropriate company safety and environmental policies     	   Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface              EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:            A qualified applicant must meet one of the following combinations of education & experience:           	   Completion of a bachelor’s degree in industrial technology or a related field AND two years of directly related experience     	   Completion of a two year technical program (wind technician, electrical, instrumentation & control electronics/fiber, mechanical maintenance, or related); AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience      	   A two year Wind Technician Program AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience     	   Completion of high school diploma or equivalent AND seven years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience.              SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:           	   Must possess advanced understanding of wind turbine operations     	   Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface     	   Valid Driver’s license required     	   Must obtain commercial applicator certification within six months of hire     	   Must be able to understand mechanics, hydraulics, and electricity (including reading & interpreting drawings); interpret documentation and support continuous improvement; and use SCADA systems for troubleshooting     	   First aid, CPR, AED, high angle rope rescue certification, forklift certification, and OSHA 10 certification preferred             Employer will not sponsor visas for position        External applicants must apply online via  www.allete.com/careers .            ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.            If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at  218-723-7553 .            EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

entries.title: Regulatory Revenue Analyst I/II
entries.content: RESPONSIBILITIES:            	    Assists with the billing of large power, municipal, and wholesale customers.      	    Prepares or reviews the monthly fuel clause calculation for retail, resale, and intersystem sales.      	    Prepares or reviews the monthly adjustments granted for rate relief by the regulators.       	    Analyzes MISO settlement statements for the many charge types and their components and prepares the accounting entries for invoicing and accruals.      	    Applies departmental policies and practices, assuring compliance with company and regulatory requirements.       	    Participates in the documentation of policies and procedures.       	    Assists in the preparation of various external regulatory reports and filings.       	    Participates in the design, implementation, maintenance and documentation of new and/or existing systems.       	    Demonstrates leadership and team characteristics.      	    Applies contract provisions in the preparation of bills for large power customers, and may assist in billing municipal and wholesale customers.                 REQUIRED EDUCATION:            	    Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered.                REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:            	    Level I     –     No experience required      	    Level II     –     Four years or more of related work experience                 SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:            	    Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships.      	    This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude.               Employer will not sponsor Visas for position.              External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers.                 ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.                If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.                EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
entries.contentSnippet: RESPONSIBILITIES:            	    Assists with the billing of large power, municipal, and wholesale customers.

entries.title: Accounting Analyst I - Opportunity Posting
entries.content: RESPONSIBILITIES:            	    Assists with preparation, processing, review, analysis, and maintenance of periodic and miscellaneous accounting entries, accounting, budget, forecasted or other financial data and transactions, company consolidations, financial and operating reports, and other accounting processes for ALLETE and its affiliates.      	    Applies departmental policies and practices, assuring compliance with company and regulatory requirements.      	    Participates in the documentation of accounting policies and procedures.      	    Assists in the preparation of various external regulatory reports and filings (SEC, MPUC, FERC, IRS, etc.)      	    Participates in the design, implementation, maintenance and documentation of new and/or existing systems.      	    Incumbents may work in any of the following areas: general accounting, property accounting, tax, budget, or financial reporting.                REQUIRED EDUCATION:            	    Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered.                REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:            	    No experience required.                SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:            	    Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships.      	    This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude.               Employer will not sponsor visas for position.                     External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers.                        ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.                       If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.                       EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

entries.title: Accounting Associate I/II -  Opportunity Posting
entries.content: RESPONSIBILITIES   :           	    Provides research, analysis, coordination and processing of routine accounting work, including ensuring accounting transactions, invoices, entries, billings, and balances are complete and accurate to meet schedules, deadlines and accounting/regulatory standards;      	    Creating, developing and analyzing manual and computerized reports/spreadsheets;      	    Providing information, procedural assistance, and training to others;      	    Coordinating and processing computerized systems to ensure reliable and available accounting data, participating in enhancements, changes, and/or implementation of computer systems;      	    Completing special projects as assigned.                REQUIRED EDUCATION:            	    High school plus a two year vocational certificate in accounting or equivalent.       	   		    Equivalent may include 2 year vocational certificates in business or other related fields but only if accounting courses, at least through intermediate level, have been taken.      	   	             REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:            	     Level I    –    No experience required.      	     Level II    –    Four years or more job related experience required                SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:            	    Requires good communication skills to establish and maintain positive working relationships.      	    This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude.               Employer will not sponsor Visas for position.                     External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers.                        ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.                       If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.                       EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
